content_list.title: Dua after Azan
content_list.subtitle: After the Azan, one should recite Durood Sharif and the Dua of Azan
content_list.content:
Narrated Jabir ibn Abdullah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

Whoever hears the adhan and recites the following dua, will be entitled to my intercession on the Day of Resurrection. (The dua is:)

اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ هٰذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيْلَةَ وَالْفَضِيْلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَّحْمُوْدًا الَّذِيْ وَعَدْتَهُ

Translation: O Allah! Lord of this perfect call and established prayer, grant Muhammad the Wasilah and the highest honor, and raise him to the praiseworthy station that You have promised him.

(Bukhari 614)

content_list.title: Intention for Wudu
content_list.subtitle: Making the intention and "reciting" the intention are not the same. The intention is to be "made", not "recited".
content_list.content: Niyyah means to intend, to resolve. When we enter the place of ablution with the intention of purifying ourselves in our minds, the niyyah for wudu is already made. Nowhere in the Qur'an or Hadith is it mentioned that any specific words of niyyah should be recited at the beginning of wudu. The words of niyyah found in various books are composed by some Arabic-speaking person; they are not collected from the Hadith. Therefore, to consider the oral recitation of these Arabic words at the beginning of wudu as essential or a work of greater reward or an indispensable part of the religion is a bid'ah (innovation).

content_list.title: Dua at the beginning of Wudu
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to say Bismillah at the beginning of Wudu
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah (I begin).

Abu Dawood, No. 101; Ibn Majah, No. 397; Ahmad, No. 9418. See also, Irwa-ul-Ghalil 1/122.

content_list.title: Dua at the end of Wudu
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to recite the Kalimatush Shahadah while looking towards the sky at the end of Wudu.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ

I bear witness that there is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone, He has no partner. I also bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger.

Muslim 1/209, No. 234

Dua 2

اَللّٰهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ التَّوَّابِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِيْنَ

O Allah! Make me among those who repent frequently and make me among those who purify themselves.

Tirmidhi-1/78, No. 55

Dua 3

سُبْحانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوْبُ إِلَيْكَ

O Allah! Glory and praise be to You. I bear witness that there is no god worthy of worship except You, I seek Your forgiveness and I repent to You.

Nasa'i, Amalul Yawmi wal Lailah, p. 173. See also, Irwa-ul-Ghalil, 1/135, 3/94.

content_list.title: Dua and Sunnahs for entering the mosque
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to enter the mosque with the right foot, seek refuge from Satan, send blessings upon the Messenger (PBUH) and recite the dua for entering the mosque.
content_list.content:
Sunnahs for entering the mosque:

1. Reciting Bismillah and Durood Sharif. The two can be recited together as follows:

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ وَالصَّلَاةُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُوْلِ اللّٰهِ

Meaning: I (enter) in the name of Allah, and peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. [1] (In one hadith, there is also mention of seeking refuge from Satan when entering the mosque. The dua mentioned in the hadith is as follows-

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ العَظِيْمِ، وَبِوَجْهِهِ الْكَرِيْمِ، وَسُلْطَانِهِ الْقَدِيْمِ، مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

Meaning: I seek refuge in Allah the Great, and in His noble Face and His eternal dominion, from the accursed Satan. [2]

If you want to recite this dua, recite it, then Bismillah and then Durood Sharif.

2. Reciting the dua for entering the mosque.

اللّٰهُمَّ افْتَحْ لِيْ أَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ

O Allah! Open for me the doors of Your mercy. [3]

3. Entering the mosque with the right foot. [4]

Reference:

[1] Ibnus Sunni, No. 8, Abu Dawood, No. 465.

[2] Abu Dawood, No. 466.

[3] Muslim 1/494, No. 713; And in Sunan Ibn Majah, in the hadith of Fatimah (may Allah be pleased with her), it is stated,

اَللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ ذُنُوْبِيْ وافْتَحْ لِيْ أبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ

“O Allah, forgive my sins and open for me the doors of Your mercy”.

See, Ibn Majah, No. 771.

[4] Hakim 1/218; Bayhaqi, 2/442.

content_list.title: Dua for leaving the mosque
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to leave the mosque with the left foot.
content_list.content:
Leave the mosque with the left foot [1] and say,

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ وَالصّلَاةُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُوْلِ اللّٰهِ، اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِك، اللّٰهُمَّ اعْصِمْنِيْ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ،

I (am leaving) in the name of Allah. May peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah! I ask You for Your grace. O Allah, protect me from the accursed Satan. [2]

[1] Al-Hakim, 1/218; Bayhaqi, 2/442.

[2] See the Takhrij of the narrations of the dua for entering the mosque mentioned earlier, and for the Takhrij of the additional part “O Allah, protect me from the accursed Satan”, see Ibn Majah 1/129.

content_list.title: Sana - Praise of Allah
content_list.subtitle: Reciting Sana is Sunnah. The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to recite Sana after Takbir-e-Tahrima.
content_list.content:
Aisha (RA) narrated that she said,

When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) started the prayer, he would say,

سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ وَتَبَارَكَ اسْمُكَ وَتَعَالٰى جَدُّكَ وَلَا إِلٰهَ غَيْرُكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Glory and praise be to You, blessed is Your name, and exalted is Your majesty. And there is no god worthy of worship other than You.

Source: Muslim-399, Abu Dawood-775, Tirmidhi-243, Ibn Majah-806, Nasa'i-89

content_list.title: Dua in Ruku
content_list.subtitle: There are many duas for reciting in Ruku.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الْعَظِيْمِ

I declare the purity and glory of my Great Lord.

Source: Abu Dawood, No. 870; Tirmidhi, No. 262; Nasa'i, No. 1007; Ibn Majah, No. 897; Ahmad, No. 3514.

Dua 2

سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

O Allah! Our Lord! Glory and praise be to You. O Allah! Forgive me.

Source: Bukhari 1/99, No. 794; Muslim 1/350, No. 484

Dua 3

سُبُّوْحٌ، قُدُّوْسٌ، رَبُّ الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالرُّوْحِ

(He is) the Most Pure, the Most Holy; the Lord of the angels and the Spirit.

Source: Muslim 1/353, No. 474; Abu Dawood 1/230, No. 872

Dua 4

سُبْحَانَ ذِيْ الْجَبَرُوْتِ، وَالْمَلَكُوْتِ، وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ، وَالْعَظَمَةِ

I declare the purity and glory of the One who possesses might, dominion, greatness, and magnificence.

Source: Abu Dawood 1/230 No. 873; Nasa'i-1131; Ahmad-13980

content_list.title: Dua for rising from Ruku
content_list.subtitle: It is Wajib to stand up straight and still after rising from Ruku.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

سَمِعَ اللّٰهُ لِمَنْ حَمِدَهُ

Allah hears (and accepts) the one who praises Him.

Source: Bukhari, No. 796

Dua 2

After reciting the first dua, the following dua should be recited.

رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ

O our Lord! And for You is all praise.

In Nafl prayers, we can also extend the dua as follows-

رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، حَمْداً كَثِيْراً طَيِّباً مُبارَكاً فِيْهِ

O our Lord! And for You is all praise; abundant, pure and blessed praise.

Source: Bukhari, No. 796

content_list.title: Dua of Sujood (Prostration)
content_list.subtitle: The servant is closest to Allah during Sujood.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الأَعْلٰى

I declare the purity and glory of my Lord, the Most High.

Source: Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 870; Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 262; Nasa'i, Hadith No. 1007; Ibn Majah, Hadith No. 897; Ahmad, Hadith No. 3514

Dua 2

سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

O Allah! Our Lord! Glory and praise be to You. O Allah! Forgive me.

Source: Bukhari, No. 794; Muslim, No. 484

Dua 3

سُبُّوْحٌ، قُدُّوْسٌ، رَبُّ الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالرُّوْحِ

(He/You are) completely free from defects, the Most Holy and Glorified; the Lord of the angels and the Spirit.

Source: Muslim 1/353, No. 487; Abu Dawood, No. 872

Dua 4

اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ ذَنْبِيْ كُلَّهُ، دِقَّهُ وَجِلَّهُ، وَأَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ، وَعَلاَنِيَّتَهُ وَسِرَّهُ

O Allah! Forgive all my sins—the small ones, the big ones, the first ones, the last ones, the open ones and the secret ones.

Source: Muslim 1/350, No. 483

content_list.title: Dua between the two prostrations
content_list.subtitle: It is Wajib to sit up straight and still between the two prostrations.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

O my Lord! Forgive me. O my Lord! Forgive me.

Source: Abu Dawood 1/231, No. 874; Ibn Majah, No. 897

Dua 2

اللّٰهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَاجْبُرْنِي، وَعَافِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي، وَارْفَعْنِيْ

O Allah! Forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, make up for my shortcomings, grant me security, provide for me, and elevate my status.

Source: Abu Dawood, 1/231, No. 850; Tirmidhi, No. 284, 285; Ibn Majah, No. 898

content_list.title: Tashahhud - Attahiyyatu
content_list.subtitle: It is Wajib to recite Tashahhud in the second and last sitting of the prayer.
content_list.content:
اَلتَّحِيَّاتُ لِلّٰهِ، وَالصَّلَوَاتُ، وَالطَّيِّبَاتُ، اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّٰهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ، اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلٰى عِبَادِ اللّٰهِ الصَّالِحِيْنَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهٗ وَرَسُوْلُهٗ

All greetings are for Allah, and so are all prayers and good deeds. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah. I bear witness that there is no god worthy of worship except Allah, and I also bear witness that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the servant and Messenger of Allah.

Source: Bukhari, No. 831; Muslim 1/301, No. 402

content_list.title: Durood Sharif
content_list.subtitle: The best of Duroods is Durood-e-Ibrahim.
content_list.content:
Durood Sharif (Durood-e-Ibrahim)

اللّٰهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ، وَعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَجِيْدٌ،

اللّٰهُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَّعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَجِيْدٌ

O Allah! Send peace upon Muhammad and upon his family, just as You sent peace upon Ibrahim and his family. Verily, You are Most Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.

O Allah! Bless Muhammad and his family as You blessed Ibrahim and his family. Verily, You are Most Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.

Bukhari, No. 3370; Muslim, No. 406

content_list.title: Dua before Salam (Dua Masura)
content_list.subtitle: One or more of the following duas can be recited after Durood Sharif and before Salam.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ ظُلْمْاً كَثِيْراً، وَلاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوْبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، فَاغْفِرْ لِيْ مَغْفِرَةً مِّنْ عِنْدِكَ وَارْحَمْنِي، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَفُوْرُ الرَّحِيْمُ

O Allah! I have wronged myself greatly. And none forgives sins except You. So forgive me with a forgiveness from Yourself and have mercy on me; You are the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Bukhari, No. 834; Muslim 4/2078, No. 2705

Dua 2

اللّٰهُمَّ أَعِنِّيْ عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ، وَشُكْرِكَ، وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ

O Allah! Help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best way.

Abu Dawood, No. 1522; Nasa'i, No. 2302

Dua 3

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، الْمَنَّانُ، يَا بَدِيْعَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّوْمُ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ

O Allah! I ask You, for all praise is for You, there is no god worthy of worship except You alone, You have no partner, O Bestower of favors; O Originator of the heavens and the earth! O Lord of Majesty and Honor! O Ever-Living, O Self-Sustaining! I ask You for Paradise and I seek refuge in You from the Hellfire.

Abu Dawood, No. 1495; Tirmidhi, No. 3544; Ibn Majah, No. 3858; Nasa'i, No. 1299

content_list.title: Dua/Zikr after Salam
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to recite the following duas and zikr after Salam.
content_list.content:
Say once:

اللّٰهُ أَكْبَر‎

Allah is the Greatest.

*** *** ***

Say three times:

أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللّٰهَ

I seek forgiveness from Allah.

Then recite:

اللّٰهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلاَمُ، وَمِنْكَ السَّلاَمُ، تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ

O Allah! You are Peace. From You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Lord of Majesty and Honor!

Muslim, No. 591

*** *** ***

Then say once,

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ،

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone. He has no partner. His is the kingdom and His is the praise, and He is powerful over all things.

Then,

اللّٰهُمَّ لاَ مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلاَ مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلاَ يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الجَدُّ

O Allah, there is no preventer of what You have given, and no giver of what You have withheld. And no wealth or power will be of any benefit against You.

Bukhari, No. 844; Muslim, No. 593

*** *** ***

Say each 33 times,

سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ

وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ

وَاللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ

How pure and great is Allah. All praise is for Allah. Allah is the greatest.

Then say,

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone. He has no partner. His is the kingdom, His is all praise, and He is powerful over all things.

Muslim, 1/418, No. 597;

*** *** ***

After Maghrib and Fajr prayers, recite 10 times,

لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِيْ وَيُمِيْتُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone. He has no partner. His is the kingdom and His is the praise, He gives life and causes death, and He is powerful over all things.

Tirmidhi 5/515, Ahmad 4/227. See the checking of the hadith in Zad al-Ma'ad 1/300.

*** *** ***

After giving salām in the Fajr prayer, recite,

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا

O Allah! I ask You for beneficial knowledge, pure provision, and deeds that are accepted.

Ibn Mājah, no. 925; al-Nasā’ī, in his work ‘Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah, hadith no. 102

*** *** ***

After every obligatory prayer, it is Sunnah to recite once: Sūrah al-Ikhlāṣ, Sūrah al-Falaq, and Sūrah al-Nās.

Abū Dāwūd, no. 1523; al-Tirmidhī, no. 2903; al-Nasā’ī, no. 1335

*** *** ***

After every prayer, recite Āyat al-Kursī (Qur’ān 2:255). Whoever recites Āyat al-Kursī after every prayer, nothing will prevent him from entering Paradise except death.

اللّٰهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّوْمُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَّلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَّهُ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهٖ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيْهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيْطُوْنَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهٖٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلاَ يَؤُوْدُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيْمُ

Allah—there is no deity worthy of worship except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of all existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass nothing of His knowledge except what He wills. His Kursī extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

al-Nasā’ī, ‘Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah, no. 100; Ibn al-Sunnī, no. 121

content_list.title: Dua-e-Qunoot
content_list.subtitle: Any of the following Qunoots can be recited in the Witr prayer.
content_list.content:
Dua-e-Qunoot 1

اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنَّا نَسْتَعِيْنُكَ وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَنُؤْمِنُ بِكَ وَنَتَوَكَّلُ عَلَيْكَ وَنُثْنِىْ عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ وَنَشْكُرُكَ وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ وَنَخْلَعُ وَنَتْرُكُ مَنْ يَّفْجُرُكَ-اَللّٰهُمَّ اِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَلَكَ نُصَلِّىْ وَنَسْجُdُ وَاِلَيْكَ نَسْعٰى وَنَحْفِدُ وَنَرْجُوْ رَحْمَتَكَ وَنَخْشٰى عَذَابَكَ اِنَّ عَذَابَكَ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ

O Allah! We seek Your help. We seek Your forgiveness, we believe in You, we trust in You, and we praise You for all good. We are grateful to you and not ungrateful. We forsake and abandon whoever disobeys You. O Allah! We worship You alone, we pray to You, and we prostrate to You. We strive towards Your obedience. We hope for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. And your punishment is indeed destined for the disbelievers.

Dua-e-Qunoot 2

اللّٰهُمَّ اهْدِنِيْ فِيْمَنْ هَدَيْتَ، وَعَافِنِيْ فِيْمَنْ عَافَيْتَ، وَتَوَلَّنِيْ فِيْمَنْ تَوَلَّيْتَ، وَبَارِكْ لِيْ فِيْمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَقِنِيْ شَرَّ مَا قَضَيْتَ

O Allah! Guide me among those You have guided, and grant me security among those You have granted security, and take me into Your care among those You have taken into Your care, and bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil of what You have decreed.

فَإِنَّكَ تَقْضِيْ وَلاَ يُقْضَى عَلَيْكَ، إِنَّهُ لاَ يَذِلُّ مَنْ وَّالَيْتَ، (وَلاَ يَعِزُّ مَنْ عَادَيْتَ) تَبارَكْتَ رَبَّنْا وَتَعَالَيْتَ

For You give the final verdict, and no verdict is given against You. He whom You befriend is never humiliated [and he whom You oppose is never honored]. You are blessed, O our Lord! And You are the Most High.

Abu Dawood, No. 1425; Tirmidhi, No. 464; Nasa'i, No. 1744; Ibn Majah, No. 1178; Ahmad, No. 1718; Darimi, No. 1592; Hakim, 3/172; Bayhaqi, 2/209. And the part between the two brackets... [truncated]

Dua-e-Qunoot 3

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ، وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوْبَتِكَ، وَأَعُــوْذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ، لاَ أُحْصِيْ ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ، أَنْتَ كَمَا أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ

O Allah! I seek refuge in Your pleasure from Your displeasure, and in Your pardon from Your punishment. And I seek refuge in You from (Your) grasp. I cannot enumerate praise upon You; You are as You have praised Yourself.

Abu Dawud (1427), Tirmidhi (3566), Nasai (1746), Ibn Majah (1179), Ahmad (751)

content_list.title: Dua to be recited during the break of every four rak'ahs of Tarawih prayer
content_list.content:
There is no specific dua to be recited during the break of every four rak'ahs of Tarawih prayer. Any dua can be recited at this time. This time is mainly for rest. Tarawih itself means rest.

In our society, there is a popular dua to be recited at this time. This dua is not mentioned in any hadith. Therefore, instead of reciting this dua with difficulty and incorrect pronunciation, recite any dua like Subhanallah, Alhamdulillah with correct pronunciation. You can even take a rest. There is no problem with that either. And it goes without saying that it is better to recite less with correct pronunciation than to recite more with incorrect pronunciation. Especially if no specific dua is mentioned in the hadith in that case.

content_list.title: Rules and Dua of Janazah Prayer
content_list.subtitle: There is no Ruku, Sujood or Qira'at in Janazah prayer.
content_list.content:
It is Sunnah to make dua for the deceased after the third takbir of the funeral prayer. A dua mentioned in the hadith is as follows:

The following dua can be recited for both adult men and women:

اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِحَيِّنَا وَمَيِّتِنَا، وَشَاهِدِنَا وَغَائِبِنَا، وَصَغِيرِنَا وَكَبِيرِنَا، وَذَكَرِنَا وَأُنْثَانَا، اللَّهُمَّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَأَحْيِهِ عَلَى الْإِسْلاَمِ، وَمَنْ تَوَفَّيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَتَوَفَّهُ عَلَى الإِيمَانِ، اللَّهُمَّ لاَ تَحْرِمْنَا أَجْرَهُ، وَلاَ تُضِلَّنَا بَعْدَهُ

Meaning: O Allah! Forgive our living and our dead, those who are present and those who are absent, our young and our old, our men and our women. O Allah! Whoever You keep alive among us, keep him alive on Islam, and whoever You cause to die among us, cause him to die with faith. O Allah! Do not deprive us of his reward, and do not mislead us after him.

(Abu Dawood 3201)

The following dua can be made for minor children:

اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ لَنَا فَرَطاً، وَسَلَفاً، وَأَجْراً

Meaning: O Allah, make him for us a forerunner, a predecessor, and a reward.

(This dua is mentioned without a chain of narration before hadith no. 1335 of Sahih Bukhari.)

If the above duas are not memorized, the following dua can be recited in the funeral prayer of all, men, women, children and the elderly:

اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ

Meaning: O Allah! Forgive all believing men and women.

content_list.title: Dua before going to sleep
content_list.subtitle: Let's make sleep an act of worship
content_list.content:
Dua

بِاسْمِكَ اللّٰهُمَّ أَمُوْتُ وَأَحْيَا

Or,

اللَّهُمَّ بِاسْـمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا

O Allah! In Your name I die (sleep) and in Your name I become alive (awake).

Bukhari, No. 6324; Muslim 4/2083, No. 2711

content_list.title: Acts and some duas before going to sleep and at night
content_list.subtitle: Let's make sleep an act of worship
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (PBUH) used to perform several acts before going to sleep. By following these Sunnahs, we can make our sleep equivalent to worship. The Sunnahs to be observed before sleeping and some nighttime acts are mentioned below.

1. Covering used plates, dishes, pots, and pans, and extinguishing the lamp

2. Performing Wudu

3. Reciting some special duas for reading before sleep (e.g., Allahumma bismika amutu wa ahya)

4. Reciting Surah Kafirun, Surah Ikhlas, Surah Falaq and Surah Nas

5. Reciting Subhanallah 33 times, Alhamdulillah 33 times, and Allahu Akbar 34 times

6. Reciting Ayatul Kursi

7. Reciting the last two verses of Surah Baqarah

8. Reciting Surah Sajdah and Surah Mulk

9. Sleeping on the right side

Duas to be recited before going to sleep

Dua 1

بِاسْمِكَ اللّٰهُمَّ أَمُوْتُ وَأَحْيَا

Or,

اللّٰهُمَّ بِاسْـمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا

O Allah! In Your name I die (sleep) and in Your name I become alive (awake).

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6324, 6325]

Dua 2

When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) intended to sleep, he would place his right hand under his cheek, then he would say this dua:

اللّٰهُمَّ قِنِيْ عَذَابَكَ يَوْمَ تَبْعَثُ عِبَادَكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Protect me from Your punishment on the day You resurrect Your servants.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, No. 5045]

Dua 3

اللّٰهُمَّ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِى وَأَنْتَ تَوَفَّاهَا لَكَ مَمَاتُهَا وَمَحْيَاهَا إِنْ أَحْيَيْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا وَإِنْ أَمَتَّهَا فَاغْفِرْ لَهَا اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّى أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَافِيَةَ

Meaning: O Allah! You have created my soul, and You will cause it to die. Its death and its life are in Your possession. If You keep it alive, then protect it, and if You cause it to die, then forgive it. O Allah! I ask you for security.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2712]

Dua 4

اللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَرَبَّ الْأَرْضِ وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ رَبَّنَا وَرَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ فَالِقَ الْحَبِّ وَالنَّوَى وَمُنْزِلَ التَّوْرَاةِ وَالْإِنْجِيلِ وَالْفُرْقَانِ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهِ اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الْأَوَّلُ فَلَيْسَ قَبْلَكَ شَيْءٌ وَأَنْتَ الْآخِرُ فَلَيْسَ بَعْدَكَ شَيْءٌ وَأَنْتَ الظَّاهِرُ فَلَيْسَ فَوْقَكَ شَيْءٌ وَأَنْتَ الْبَاطِنُ فَلَيْسَ دُونَكَ شَيْءٌ اقْضِ عَنَّا الدَّيْنَ وَأَغْنِنَا مِنْ الْفَقْرِ

Meaning: O Allah, Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth and Lord of the Mighty Throne, our Lord and Lord of all things, Cleaver of the grain and the date-stone, Revealer of the Torah, the Injeel and the Furqan, I seek refuge in You from the evil of all things that You seize by the forelock. O Allah, You are the First, so there is nothing before You, and You are the Last, so there is nothing after You, and You are the Manifest, so there is nothing above You, and You are the Hidden, so there is nothing below You. Settle our debt for us and enrich us from poverty.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2713]

Dua 5

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا، وَكَفَانَا، وَآوَانَا، فَكَمْ مِمَّنْ لاَ كَافِيَ لَهُ وَلاَ مُؤْوِيَ

Meaning: All praise is for Allah, who has fed us, given us drink, fulfilled our needs, and sheltered us. For there are many people who have no one to fulfill their needs and no one to shelter them.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2715]

Dua 6

اللّٰهُمَّ فَاطِرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ ، عَالِمَ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ ، رَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَمَلِيكَهُ ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي ، وَشَرِّ الشَّيْطَانِ وَشِرْكِهِ

Meaning: O Allah! The Creator of the heavens and the earth, the Knower of all things visible and invisible, the Sustainer and Master of everything! I bear witness that there is no god worthy of worship but You. I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul, from the evil of Satan and his polytheism (shirk) or his snares.

[Sunan Abi Dawud, Hadith 5067]

Dua 7

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "When you go to bed, you should say,

اللّٰهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ إِلَيْكَ، وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِيْ إِلَيْكَ، وَوَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِيْ إِلَيْكَ، وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِيْ إِلَيْكَ، رَغْبَةً وَّرَهْبَةً إِلَيْكَ، لاَ مَلْجَأَ وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ، آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِيْ أَنْزَلْتَ، وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِيْ أَرْسَلْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! I have surrendered myself to You, entrusted all my affairs to You, turned my face toward You, and laid my back upon You, with hope in You and fear of You. There is no refuge and no escape from You except to You. I have believed in Your book which You have sent down, and in Your Prophet, whom You have sent.

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to the one he taught this dua: "If you die that night, you will die upon the natural religion (fitrah) of Islam."

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6313]

Dua 8

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When one of you gets up from his bed and then returns to it, he should brush it three times with the corner of his garment or his loincloth. For he does not know what came onto it after he left. Then, when he lies down, he should say this dua,

بِاسْمِكَ رَبِّي وَضَعْتُ جَنْبِي ، وَبِكَ أَرْفَعُهُ ، فَإِنْ أَمْسَكْتَ نَفْسِي فَارْحَمْهَا ، وَإِنْ أَرْسَلْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا بِمَا تَحْفَظُ بِهِ عِبَادَكَ الصَّالِحِينَ

Meaning: My Lord! In Your name, I have laid down my side (I have laid down to sleep) and with Your name, I will rise. If you take my soul (while I am sleeping), then have mercy on it. And if You return it, then protect it in the same way that You protect Your righteous servants.

[Jami' at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3401]

Dua upon waking up

الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ

Meaning: All praise is for Allah, who has given us life after causing us to die, and to Him is the resurrection.

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6324]

Practices for the Night or Before Going to Sleep

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to perform several acts before going to sleep. By performing these Sunnahs, we can make our sleep equivalent to worship. The following are some of the Sunnahs before sleeping.

Cover utensils, pots, and pans

Cover your utensils, pots, and pans. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "When you go to sleep, extinguish the lamps, shut the doors, cover the mouths of the water skins, and cover the food and drinks."

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5624]

(Here, lamps refer to such lamps which may cause a fire if left lit while sleeping.)

Perform Wudu (Ablution)

Perform wudu. It is narrated in a hadith that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "When you go to bed, perform wudu first. Then lie down on your right side."

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 247]

Recite dua before sleeping

Recite the special duas mentioned at the beginning of the post before sleeping, as much as you can. (For example: Allahumma bismika amutu wa ahya)

Recite Surah al-Kafirun, Surah al-Ikhlas, Surah al-Falaq, and Surah an-Nas

It is narrated from Farwah ibn Nawfal (may Allah be pleased with him) that he came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) and said, "O Messenger of Allah! Teach me something that I can recite when I go to bed." He said: "Recite Surah al-Kafirun, for it is a declaration of freedom from polytheism."

[Jami' at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3403]

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, once said to his companions, "Can one of you not recite one-third of the Quran in one night?" This seemed difficult to the companions, so they said, "O Messenger of Allah! Who among us can do this?" He said, "Surah al-Ikhlas is equal to one-third of the Quran." (Meaning, reciting this surah will earn the reward of reciting one-third of the Quran.)

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5015]

It is narrated from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) that when the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) would go to bed every night, he would bring his palms together, blow into them, and recite Surah al-Ikhlas, al-Falaq, and an-Nas. Then he would wipe his hands over as much of his body as he could, starting with his head, face, and the front of his body. He would do this three times.

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5017]

Recite Subhanallah 33 times, Alhamdulillah 33 times, and Allahu Akbar 34 times

Recite Subhanallah 33 times, Alhamdulillah 33 times, and Allahu Akbar 34 times. It is narrated from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said, when Fatima (may Allah be pleased with her) asked the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, for a servant, he said, "Shall I teach you two things that are better than what you asked for? When you go to bed, recite Subhanallah 33 times, Alhamdulillah 33 times, and Allahu Akbar 34 times. This is better for you than a servant."

[Bukhari, Hadith 5361, 6318]

Recite Ayat al-Kursi

Recite Ayat al-Kursi. The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "When you go to bed, recite Ayat al-Kursi. Then a guardian from Allah will always be appointed for you, and Satan will not come near you until the morning."

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2311]

اللَّهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ لاَ تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلاَ نَوْمٌ لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الأَرْضِ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِهِ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلاَ يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلاَّ بِمَا شَاءَ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاواتِ وَالأَرْضَ وَلاَ يَئُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ

Meaning: Allah! There is no true god except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of all existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what is behind them, but they do not encompass any part of His knowledge except what He wills. His Kursi (throne) extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation does not burden Him. He is the Most High, the Most Magnificent.

[Surah Al-Baqarah 255]

Recite the last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "Whoever recites the last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah at night, they will be sufficient for him."

[Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5009, Sahih Muslim, Hadith 807]

Imam An-Nawawi (may Allah have mercy on him), the author of the famous hadith book "Riyadhus Saliheen" and commentator on Sahih Muslim, said, "Some have said its meaning is that it will be sufficient for Qiyam al-Layl or Tahajjud prayer. Some have said it will be sufficient to be protected from the harm of Satan. Some have said it will be a security from misfortunes. However, all these meanings are likely to be correct."

The last two verses of Surah Al-Baqarah:

اٰمَنَ الرَّسُوْلُ بِمَاۤ اُنْزِلَ اِلَیْهِ مِنْ رَّبِّهٖ وَ الْمُؤْمِنُوْنَ ؕ كُلٌّ اٰمَنَ بِاللّٰهِ وَ مَلٰٓىِٕكَتِهٖ وَ كُتُبِهٖ وَ رُسُلِهٖ ۫ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَیْنَ اَحَدٍ مِّنْ رُّسُلِهٖ ۫ وَ قَالُوْا سَمِعْنَا وَ اَطَعْنَا ؗۗ غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَ اِلَیْكَ الْمَصِیْرُ ۝ لَا یُكَلِّفُ اللّٰهُ نَفْسًا اِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ؕ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَ عَلَیْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ ؕ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَاۤ اِنْ نَّسِیْنَاۤ اَوْ اَخْطَاْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَیْنَاۤ اِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهٗ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهٖ ۚ وَ اعْفُ عَنَّا ۥ وَ اغْفِرْ لَنَا ۥ وَ ارْحَمْنَا ۥ اَنْتَ مَوْلٰىنَا فَانْصُرْنَا عَلَی الْقَوْمِ الْكٰفِرِیْنَ۠ ۝

Meaning: The Messenger believes in what has been sent down to him from his Lord, and so do the believers. Each one believes in Allah, His angels, His books, and His messengers. (They say,) "We make no distinction between any of His messengers." And they say, "We hear and we obey. We seek Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the return."

Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity. It will have the reward for what it earns, and it will be held accountable for what it earns. (O Muslims! You should supplicate to Allah with this dua,) "Our Lord, do not hold us accountable if we forget or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not lay upon us a burden like the one You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, do not burden us with what we have no strength to bear. And pardon us; forgive us; have mercy on us. You are our Guardian. So, grant us victory over the disbelieving people."

[Surah Al-Baqarah 285-286]

Recite Surah as-Sajdah and Surah al-Mulk

This is a night practice: Reciting Surah as-Sajdah and Surah al-Mulk. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, never used to sleep without reciting Surah as-Sajdah and Surah al-Mulk.

[Jami' at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2892]

content_list.title: Dua after waking up from sleep
content_list.subtitle: Let our day begin with the praise and gratitude of Allah
content_list.content:
Dua 1

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا، وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُوْرُ

All praise is for Allah, who gave us life after causing us to die (in the form of sleep), and to Him is the resurrection of all.

Bukhari, No. 6314; Muslim, No. 2711

Dua 2

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ، وَاللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللّٰهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيْمِ، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone. He is one and has no partner; His is the kingdom, and His is the praise; and He is powerful over all things. Allah is pure and great. All praise and glory be to Allah. There is no god worthy of worship except Allah. Allah is the greatest. There is no power and no strength except with the help of Allah, the Most High, the Most Great. O my Lord! Forgive me.

Bukhari, No. 1154.

Dua 3

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ عَافَانِيْ فِيْ جَسَدِي، وَرَدَّ عَلَيَّ رُوْحِي، وَأَذِنَ لِيْ بِذِكْرِهِ

All praise and glory be to Allah, who has kept my body safe, returned my soul to me, and permitted me (opportunity) to remember Him.

Tirmidhi, No. 3401.

content_list.title: Dua for entering the toilet
content_list.subtitle: By reciting the dua before entering the toilet, one can be safe from evil jinn and devils.
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْخُبْثِ وَالْخَبَائِثِ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You from the male and female evil spirits.

Bukhari, No. 142; Muslim, No. 375, Tirmidhi, No. 606.

content_list.title: Dua after coming out of the toilet
content_list.subtitle: We can recite any or both of the following duas
content_list.content:
Dua 1

غُفْرَانَكَ

I seek Your forgiveness.

This hadith has been narrated by all the authors of the Sunan books except Nasa'i; however, Nasa'i has narrated it in his ‘Amalul Yawmi wal-Lailah’ (No. 79). Abu Dawood, No. 30; Tirmidhi, No. 7; Ibn Majah, No. 300.

Dua 2

الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَذْهَبَ عَنِّي الْأَذَى وَعَافَانِي

All praise is for Allah, who has removed the harmful thing from me and has granted me safety.

Ibn Majah, Hadith 303. This hadith is a da'if or weak hadith. There is no problem in acting upon such a hadith in the case of duas.

content_list.title: Dua for wearing clothes
content_list.subtitle: By following the Sunnah, we can make every act of our lives an act of worship.
content_list.content:
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ كَسَانِيْ هَذَا الثَّوْبَ وَرَزَقَنِيْهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّيْ وَلاَ قُوَّةٍ

All praise is for Allah; who has clothed me with this (garment) and has provided it to me without any strength or power on my part.

Abu Dawood, No. 4023.

content_list.title: Dua for wearing new clothes
content_list.subtitle: New clothes are a blessing from Allah, and expressing gratitude for a blessing is an act of worship.
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ كَسَوْتَنِيْهِ، أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِهِ وَخَيْرِ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وَشَرِّ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ

O Allah! To You belongs all praise. You have clothed me with it. I ask You for its good and the good for which it was made. And I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil for which it was made.

Abu Dawood, No. 4020; Tirmidhi, No. 1767.

content_list.title: Dua for someone who is seen wearing new clothes
content_list.subtitle: Wishing well for another Muslim brother is an act of worship.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

تُبْلِيْ وَيُخْلِفُ اللّٰهُ تَعَالَى

May you wear it out, and may Allah the Exalted replace it.

Sunan Abi Dawood, No. 4020.

Dua 2

اِلْبَسْ جَدِيْداً وَّعِشْ حَمِيْداً وَّمُتْ شَهِيْداً

Wear new clothes, live a praiseworthy life, and die as a martyr.

Sunan Ibn Majah, No. 3558.

content_list.title: Dua at the beginning of a meal
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to wash both hands well before starting to eat.
content_list.content:
At the beginning of eating and drinking, we will say

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah (I begin to eat)

And if you forget to say Bismillah at the beginning,

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ أَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ

In the name of Allah at the beginning and end (of eating)

Abu Dawood 3/347, No. 3767

content_list.title: Dua after finishing a meal
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to wash both hands well after finishing a meal.
content_list.content:
Dua 1

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ اَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا وَجَعَلَنَا مُسْلِمِيْنَ

Meaning: All praise is for Allah, who has fed us and given us to drink and made us Muslims.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 3852]

Dua 2

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ اَطْعَمَ وَسَقٰى وَسَوَّغَهٗ وَجَعَلَ لَهٗ مَخْرَجًا

Meaning: All praise is for Allah, who has fed and given to drink, has made it easy to digest, and has also provided a way for it to exit.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 3853]

Dua 3

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِىْ اَطْعَمَنِـيْ هٰذَا الطَّعَامَ وَرَزَقَنِيْهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّـيْ وَلَا قُوَّةٍ

Meaning: All praise is for Allah, who has fed me this food and provided it to me without any strength or power on my part.

Virtue: It is mentioned in the hadith that whoever recites this dua after eating, his past and future sins will be forgiven.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4025]

Dua 4

اللّٰهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيْهِ وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ

O Allah! Bless us in this food and feed us with better than it.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith 3455]

Dua after drinking milk

اللّٰهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيْهِ وَزِدْنَا مِنْهُ

O Allah! Bless us in it (this milk) and grant us more than it.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith 3455]

content_list.title: Dua when leaving the house
content_list.subtitle: Dua for seeking protection and refuge from the whispers of Satan
content_list.content:
Dua 1

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ، تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللّٰهِ، لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللّٰهِ

In the name of Allah (I am leaving). I have put my trust in Allah. And there is no power and no strength except with the help of Allah.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 5095; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3426]

Dua 2

اللّٰـهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ، أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ، أَوْ أُزَلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ، أَوْ أُظْلَمَ، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ، أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You from going astray myself or from someone else leading me astray; from slipping myself, or from someone else causing me to slip; from doing wrong myself or from being wronged; from being ignorant myself, or from ignorance being shown to me.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 5094; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3427; Nasa'i, Hadith 5501; Ibn Majah, Hadith 3884]

content_list.title: Dua when entering the house
content_list.subtitle: It is Sunnah to greet the people of the house with Salam when entering.
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ وَلَجْنَا، وَبِسْمِ اللّٰهِ خَرَجْنَا، وَعَلَى اللّٰهِ رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّلْنَا

In the name of Allah we entered, in the name of Allah we left, and upon Allah our Lord we have put our trust.

After reciting this dua, greet the people of the house with Salam.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 5096]

In another hadith, it is said that when one of you enters his house, and remembers Allah at the time of entering and at the time of eating, Satan says (to his disciples), ‘You have no place to stay and no supper.’

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2018]

content_list.title: Dua when the wind blows
content_list.subtitle: Seeking refuge from the evil of the wind
content_list.content:
لّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَسْاَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا فِيْهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا اُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ ، وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَشَرِّ مَا فِيْهَا وَشَرِّ مَا اُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ

Meaning: O Allah! I ask You for the good of this wind, the good that is in it, and the good with which it has been sent. And I seek refuge in You from the evil of this wind, the evil that is in it, and the evil with which it has been sent.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 899]

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا

O Allah! I ask You for its good. And I seek refuge in You from its evil.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 5099; Ibn Majah, Hadith 3727]

content_list.title: Dua upon hearing the sound of thunder
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ لَا تَقْتُلْنَا بِغَضَبِكَ وَلَا تُهْلِكْنَا بِعَذَابِكَ وَعَافِنَا قَبْلَ ذٰلِكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Do not kill us with Your anger and do not destroy us with Your punishment. Rather, grant us safety and salvation before that.

[Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3450]

content_list.title: Dua when it rains
content_list.subtitle: Praying for the rain of mercy
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ صَيِّباً نَافِعاً

O Allah! Make this rain beneficial for us.

[Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 24144]

content_list.title: Dua for boarding a vehicle
content_list.subtitle: May Allah protect us from road accidents
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ ، سُبْحَانَ الَّذِيْ سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِيْنَ، وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنْقَلِبُوْنَ ، الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، الْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، اللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ، سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ فَاغْفِرْ لِيْ ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوْبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ

I begin my journey in the name of Allah; and all praise is for Allah. Glory be to the One who has subjugated this for us, otherwise we would not have been able to subjugate it. And we will surely return to our Lord. All praise is for Allah, all praise is for Allah, all praise is for Allah. Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest. O Allah! You are pure and great; I have wronged myself, so forgive me. For none forgives sins except You.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 2602; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3446]

content_list.title: Dua for entering the market
content_list.subtitle: The market is the most disliked place to Allah.
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever enters the market and recites this dua, Allah Ta'ala will write for him ten lakh good deeds, forgive his ten lakh sins and increase his honor by ten lakh times.

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، يُحْيِيْ وَيُمِيْتُ، وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لاَ يَمُوْتُ، بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

There is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the kingdom, and His is all praise. He gives life and He gives death. And He is the Ever-Living, He will not die. All kinds of good are in His hands. He is powerful over all things. [Tirmidhi, No. 3428; Ibn Majah, No. 3860]

content_list.title: Dua for entering a new village or city
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَمَا اَظْلَلْنَ ، وَرَبَّ الْاَرَضِيْنَ السَّبْعِ وَمَا اَقْلَلْنَ ، وَرَبَّ الرِّيَاحِ وَمَا ذَرَيْنَ ، وَرَبَّ الشَّيَاطِيْنِ وَمَا اَضْلَلْنَ نَسْاَلُكَ خَيْرَ هٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ وَخَيْرَ اَهْلِهَا ، وَنَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا وَشَرِّ اَهْلِهَا وَشَرِّ مَا فِيْهَا.

Meaning: O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens! And Lord of all that the heavens shade! Lord of the seven earths and all that they contain! Lord of the winds and all that they carry away! Lord of the devils and those whom they mislead! We ask You for the good of this area and the good of its people. And we seek refuge in You from the evil of this area and the evil of its people and the evil of all that is in it.

[Sahih Ibn Hibban, Hadith 2709]

content_list.title: Dua when repaying a debt to someone who has given a loan
content_list.subtitle: The reward for the lender is to repay the loan on time and to express gratitude to him.
content_list.content:
بارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ فِيْ أَهْلِكَ وَمَالِكَ

May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth.

[Sunan an-Nasa'i, Hadith 4683]

content_list.title: Dua for someone who has treated you well
content_list.content:
جَزَاكَ اللّٰهُ خَيْراً

May Allah reward you with good.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 2035]

content_list.title: What a person should say when praised in front of a Muslim
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنِيْ بِمَا يَقُوْلُوْنَ، وَاغْفِرْ لِيْ مَا لاَ يَعْلَمُوْنَ، (وَاجْعَلْنِيْ خَيْراً مِمَّا يَظُّنُّوْنَ)

O Allah, do not hold me accountable for what they say, and forgive me for what they do not know (about me). And make me better than what they think.

[Shu'ab al-Iman, Hadith 4534]

content_list.title: Dua when hearing the crowing of a rooster and the braying of a donkey or the barking of a dog at night
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: When you hear the crowing of a rooster, then ask for the grace of Allah, because it has seen an angel. And when you hear the braying of a donkey, then seek refuge in Allah from Satan; because it has seen a devil.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3303]

In another hadith, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: When you hear the barking of a dog and the braying of a donkey at night, then seek refuge in Allah from them; because they see something that you do not see.”

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 5105]

Dua for seeking refuge in Allah:

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْـمِ

I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan.

content_list.title: Dua after sneezing and its reply
content_list.content:
The one who sneezes should say-

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ

All praise is for Allah

And whoever hears this dua should say-

يَرْحَمُكَ اللّٰهُ

May Allah have mercy on you.

Then the sneezer should say-

يَهْدِيْكُمُ اللّٰهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ

May Allah guide you and improve your condition.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5870]

content_list.title: Dua before intercourse with wife
content_list.subtitle: Seeking refuge for a righteous child and from Satan
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ، اللّٰهُمَّ جَنِّبْنَا الشَّيْطَانَ، وَجَنِّبِ الشَّيْطَانَ مَا رَزَقْتَنَا

In the name of Allah. O Allah! Keep us away from Satan, and keep Satan away from the child You will grant us.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 141]

content_list.title: Dua for the person who says, ‘I love you for the sake of Allah’
content_list.content:
أَحَبَّكَ الَّذِيْ أَحْبَبْتَنِيْ لَهُ

May He for whose sake you have loved me, love you.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 5125]

content_list.title: Dua for Iftar
content_list.subtitle: The dua of a fasting person before Iftar is not rejected.
content_list.content:
Before breaking the fast

اللّٰهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْتُ وَعَلَى رِزْقِكَ أَفْطَرْتُ

O Allah! For Your satisfaction I have fasted and with the provision You have given I am breaking my fast.

[Abu Dawood, Hadith 2360]

After breaking the fast

ذَهَبَ الظَّمَأُ وَابْتَلَّتِ العُرُوْقُ، وَثَبَتَ الْأَجْرُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللّٰهُ

The thirst has quenched, the veins are moistened, and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.

[Abu Dawood, No. 2359]

content_list.title: Dua for the host family when breaking the fast as a guest
content_list.subtitle: Whoever gives Iftar to a fasting person will have a reward like his.
content_list.content:
أَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُوْنَ، وَأَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الْأَبْرَارُ، وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ

May the fasting people break their fast with you, may the righteous eat your food, and may the angels pray for your forgiveness.

Sunan Abi Dawood, No. 3856; Ibn Majah, No. 1747

content_list.title: Dua for Laylat al-Qadr
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ إِنَّكَ عَفُوٌّ تُحِبُّ الْعَفْوَ فَاعْفُ عَنِّيْ

O Allah! You are Forgiving, You love to forgive, so forgive me.

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 3850

content_list.title: Ayatul Kursi - Protection from Jinn and Satan
content_list.subtitle: Ayatul Kursi is the greatest verse of the Quran
content_list.content:
Whoever recites Ayatul Kursi in the morning will be under the protection of Allah from jinn and devils until the evening, and whoever recites it in the evening will be under the protection of Allah from jinn and devils until the morning.

اَللّٰهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ اَلْحَىُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهٗ سِنَةٌ وَّلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَهٗ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ؕ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهٗ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهٖ ؕ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهٖۤ إِلَّا بِمَاشَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ وَلَا يَـُٔوْدُهٗ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيمُ

Allah, there is no true god but He. He is the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining. Neither drowsiness nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot comprehend anything of His knowledge except what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation does not tire Him. He is the Most High, the Most Great.

(Surah Al-Baqarah-255)

Hakim, Mustadrak, Hadith 2064

content_list.title: Surah Ikhlas, Falaq and Nas are sufficient for the security of everything
content_list.subtitle: Surahs for protection from magic, evil eye and jinn and devils
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever recites Surah Ikhlas, Surah Falaq and Surah Nas three times in the morning and in the evening, it will be sufficient for him for everything (for security).

(Abu Dawood, No. 5082, Tirmidhi, No. 3575)

Surah Ikhlas

قُلْ هُوَ اللّٰهُ أَحَدٌ ﴿١﴾ اللّٰهُ الصَّمَدُ ﴿٢﴾ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُوْلَدْ ﴿٣﴾ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَّهٗ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ ﴿﴾٤

Say, He is Allah, the One and Only. Allah is the ‘Samad’ (He is not in need of anyone, everyone is in need of Him). He has not begotten anyone, nor was He begotten. And there is none comparable to Him.

Surah Falaq

قُلْ أَعُوْذُ بِرَ‌بِّ الْفَلَقِ ﴿١﴾ مِنْ شَرِّ‌ مَا خَلَقَ ﴿٢﴾ وَمِنْ شَرِّ‌ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ﴿٣﴾ وَمِنْ شَرِّ‌ النَّفّٰثٰتِ فِيْ الْعُقَدِ ﴿٤﴾ وَمِنْ شَرِّ‌ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ﴿٥﴾

Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of the dawn. From the evil of what He has created. ‘And from the evil of the darkness of the night, when it becomes deep. And from the evil of all women who blow on knots. And from the evil of the envier when he envies.

Surah Nas

قُلْ أَعُوْذُ بِرَ‌بِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِنْ شَرِّ‌ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِيْ يُوَسْوِسُ فِيْ صُدُوْرِ‌ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾

Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers into the hearts of mankind, from among the jinn and mankind.

content_list.title: Dua for protection from all kinds of evil
content_list.subtitle: By the grace of this dua, Insha'Allah you will be free from all kinds of evil"
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua three times in the morning and three times in the evening, nothing will harm him.

بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ الَّذِيْ لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِيْ الْأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِيْ السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيْعُ الْعَلِيْمُ

In the name of Allah; with whose name nothing on earth or in the heavens can cause harm. And He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.”

Abu Dawood, No. 5088; Tirmidhi, No. 3388; Ibn Majah, No. 3869.

content_list.title: Dua for freedom from the fire of Hell
content_list.subtitle: 7 times after Fajr and Maghrib
content_list.content:
If someone recites the following dua seven times after the Maghrib prayer, and then dies that night, freedom from Hell will be written for him. Similarly, if he recites the dua seven times after the Fajr prayer and dies that day, freedom from Hell will be written for him. The dua is:

اللَّهُمَّ أَجِرْنِي مِنَ النَّارِ

O Allah! Protect me from the Hellfire.

Sunan Abu Dawood 5079

content_list.title: The virtue of the last three verses of Surah Hashr
content_list.subtitle: 70,000 angels will be appointed for dua
content_list.content:
Ma'qil ibn Yasar (RA) narrated that he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said

Whoever says three times in the morning (after waking up),

أَعُوذُ بِاللّٰهِ السَّمِيعِ الْعَلِيمِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ

And then recites the last three verses of Surah Hashr, Allah Ta'ala will appoint seventy thousand angels for him. They will continue to pray for him until the evening. If he dies on that day, he will have the death of a martyr. Whoever recites this dua in the evening will also receive the same status.

[Tirmidhi, Hadith 2922]

The last three verses of Surah Hashr:

هُوَ اللّٰهُ الَّذِیْ لَاۤ اِلٰهَ اِلَّا هُوَ ۚ عٰلِمُ الْغَیْبِ وَ الشَّهَادَةِ ۚ هُوَ الرَّحْمٰنُ الرَّحِیْمُ۝۲۲ هُوَ اللّٰهُ الَّذِیْ لَاۤ اِلٰهَ اِلَّا هُوَ ۚ اَلْمَلِكُ الْقُدُّوْسُ السَّلٰمُ الْمُؤْمِنُ الْمُهَیْمِنُ الْعَزِیْزُ الْجَبَّارُ الْمُتَكَبِّرُ ؕ سُبْحٰنَ اللّٰهِ عَمَّا یُشْرِكُوْنَ۝۲۳ هُوَ اللّٰهُ الْخَالِقُ الْبَارِئُ الْمُصَوِّرُ لَهُ الْاَسْمَآءُ الْحُسْنٰی ؕ یُسَبِّحُ لَهُٗ مَا فِی السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ الْاَرْضِ ۚ وَ هُوَ الْعَزِیْزُ الْحَكِیْمُ۠۝۲۴

content_list.title: Dua to remove all worries
content_list.subtitle: This dua will remove all the worries and anxieties of your mind, Insha'Allah
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua 7 times in the morning and 7 times in the evening, Allah will be sufficient for him for all his thoughts of this world and the hereafter.

حَسْبِيَ اللّٰهُ لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ

Allah is sufficient for me, there is no god worthy of worship but Him. I have put my trust in Him. And He is the Lord of the Great Throne.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 5081. This hadith is narrated from Hazrat Abu Darda (RA).

content_list.title: Dua to be the best
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua 100 times in the morning and 100 times in the evening, no one will be able to bring anything better than him on the Day of Resurrection, except for the person who does the same deed as him or does more deeds than him.

سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ

Meaning: I recite the tasbih of Allah with His praise.

Muslim, Hadith 2692.

content_list.title: Equivalent to freeing ten slaves and one hundred rewards
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua 100 times a day, it will be equivalent to freeing 10 slaves for him (in reward). 100 rewards will be written for him. His 100 sins will be erased. It will be considered as a means of protection from Satan for him until the evening of that day. And no one (on the Day of Resurrection) will be able to bring anything like him. Yes, except for the person who does more deeds than him. The dua is:

لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

Meaning: There is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the kingdom, and His is all praise, and He is powerful over all things.

[Bukhari, Hadith No. 3293; Muslim, Hadith No. 2691]

In another narration, it is said that if someone recites the dua once in the morning, he will have the reward of freeing an Isma'ili slave, ten good deeds will be written for him, ten sins will be forgiven, his status will be raised by ten levels, and he will be safe from Satan until the evening. If someone recites it in the evening, he will receive the same result until the morning.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 5079]

In another hadith, it is said that if someone recites the dua ten times, he will have the reward of freeing ten slaves.

[Nasa'i, Amalul Yawmi wal Lailah, Hadith No. 24]

content_list.title: Masnoon Dua of morning and evening 1
content_list.subtitle: Prayer for seeking release from misfortune, laziness, and Hell
content_list.content:
Recite in the morning:

أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِيْ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيْ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِيْ النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِيْ الْقَبْرِ

We have entered the morning for Allah, and similarly, all dominion has entered the morning for Allah. All praise is for Allah. There is no true god but Allah alone; He has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is powerful over all things. O Lord! I ask you for the good that is in this day and the good that is to come. And I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in this day and the evil that is after it.

O Lord! I seek refuge in You from laziness and the evil of old age. O Lord! I seek refuge in You from the punishment in the Hellfire and the punishment in the grave.

Recite in the evening:

أَمْسَيْنَا وَ أَمْسَىا الْمُلْكُ لِلّٰهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إلاَّ اللّٰهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِيْ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيْ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِيْ النَّarِ وَعَذَابٍ فِيْ الْقَبْرِ

We have entered the evening for Allah, and all sovereignty has also entered the evening for Allah. All praise is for Allah. There is no true deity except Allah alone, without a partner. His is the dominion, and His is the praise, and He is over all things capable. O Lord! I ask You for the goodness of this night and the goodness that comes after it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil that comes after it.

O Lord! I seek refuge in You from laziness and the evil of old age. O Lord! I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hellfire and the punishment of the grave.

Muslim, Hadith No. 2723

content_list.title: Masnoon Dua of morning and evening 2
content_list.content:
In the morning, say,

اللّٰهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوْتُ وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُوْرُ

O Allah! We have entered the morning by Your grace, we have entered the evening. You give us life and death, and to You is the resurrection of all.

In the evening, say,

اللّٰهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوْتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيْرُ.

O Allah! We have entered the evening by Your grace, we have entered the morning. You give us life and death, and to You is the resurrection of all.

Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 3391

content_list.title: Masnoon Dua of morning and evening 3
content_list.content:
Say three times,

اللّٰهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِيْ بَدَنِي، اللّٰهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِيْ سَمْعِي، اللّٰهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِيْ بَصَرِي، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ، وَالفَقْرِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ

O Allah! Grant me security in my body. O Allah! Grant me security in my hearing. O Allah! Grant me security in my sight. There is no god worthy of worship but You. O Allah! I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty. And I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is no true god but You.

Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 5092

content_list.title: Masnoon Dua of morning and evening 4
content_list.content:
يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّوْمُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيْثُ أَصْلِحْ لِيْ شَأْنِيَ كُلَّهُ وَلاَ تَكِلْنِيْ إِلَى نَفْسِيْ طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ

O Ever-Living, O Self-Sustaining! I seek Your help through Your mercy, correct all my affairs for me, and do not entrust me to myself for the blink of an eye.

Hakim, Al-Mustadrak, Hadith No. 2000

content_list.title: Dua for forgiveness of sins
content_list.subtitle: Even a grave sin like fleeing from the battlefield will be forgiven by repenting through this istighfar.
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, “Whoever recites this dua, Allah will forgive him even if he is a fugitive from the battlefield.”

أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللّٰهَ الَّذِيْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ القَيُّوْمُ وَأَتُوْبُ إِلَيْهِ

I seek forgiveness from Allah, besides whom there is no true god, He is the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining. And I repent to Him.’

[Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 1517; Tirmidhi, Hadith No. 3577]

It should be noted that along with reciting the above words of istighfar, it is also necessary to repent from the heart. If someone sincerely seeks forgiveness with these words, that is, asks for forgiveness for his sins, only then will he receive the above reward.

content_list.title: Sayyidul Istighfar - The best dua for seeking forgiveness
content_list.subtitle: The istighfar through which Allah will forgive all the sins of the servant and admit him to Paradise
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ اَنْتَ رَبِّـيْ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِـيْ وَاَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَاَنَا عَلـٰى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ اَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ اَبُوْءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ وَاَبُوْءُ لَكَ بِذَنْبِـيْ فَاغْفِرْ لِـيْ فَاِنَّهٗ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوْبَ اِلَّا اَنْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! You are my Lord. There is no god but You. You have created me. I am Your slave. I am fulfilling the promise I made to You as much as I can. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your favor upon me before You. I also acknowledge my sin before You. So forgive me. For none forgives sins except You.

Virtue: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever recites it in the morning with full faith, and then dies before the evening, he will be a person of Paradise. And if he recites it in the evening and dies before the morning, he will also be a person of Paradise.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6306

content_list.title: Dua to wipe away sins equal to the foam of the sea
content_list.subtitle: The istighfar through which Allah will forgive all the sins of the servant and admit him to Paradise
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, whoever recites this dua 100 times a day, his sins will be wiped away, even if they are equal to the foam of the sea.

سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ

I declare the glorious purity of Allah with His praise.

Bukhari, Hadith No. 6405; Muslim, Hadith No. 2691

It should be noted that the forgiveness of sins mentioned through these deeds refers only to minor sins. It is necessary to repent to get major sins forgiven.

content_list.title: The pleasure of Allah on the Day of Resurrection
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua three times in the morning and in the evening, it becomes the responsibility of Allah to please him on the Day of Resurrection.

رَضِيْتُ بِاللّٰهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلاَمِ دِيْنًا وَّبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا

I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet.

Ahmad, No. 18967; Abu Dawood, No. 1531; Tirmidhi, No. 3389.

content_list.title: Dua for freedom from the fire of Hell
content_list.subtitle: Testimony of the oneness of Allah and the messengership of the Messenger (PBUH)
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua four times in the morning or in the evening, Allah will free him from the fire of Hell.

Recite in the morning:

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنّيْ أَصْبَحْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلاَئِكَتَكَ، وَجَمِيْعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللّٰهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُوْلُكَ

O Allah! I have entered the morning. I call You to witness, and I call to witness the bearers of Your Throne, Your angels, and all Your creation, (upon this) that You are indeed Allah, there is no true god but You alone, You have no partner; and that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is Your servant and Messenger.

Recite in the evening:

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنّيْ اَمْسَيْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلاَئِكَتَكَ، وَجَمِيْعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللّٰهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُوْلُكَ

O Allah! I have entered the evening. I call You to witness, and I call to witness the bearers of Your Throne, Your angels, and all Your creation, (upon this) that You are indeed Allah, there is no true god but You alone, You have no partner; and that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is Your servant and Messenger.

Abu Dawood, Hadith No. 5071; Bukhari, Al-Adab al-Mufrad, No. 1201

content_list.title: Dua for expressing gratitude for the whole day and night
content_list.subtitle: If you are grateful to Allah, Allah will increase your blessings even more.
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua in the morning has expressed gratitude for that day. And whoever recites this dua in the evening has expressed gratitude for the night. Recite in the morning:

اللّٰهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ بِيْ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ

O Allah! Whatever blessing has come to me in the morning (or evening), or to any of Your creation; these blessings are from You alone; You have no partner. So all praise is for You. And all gratitude is due to You.

Recite in the evening:

اللّٰهُمَّ مَا اَمْسٰى بِيْ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ

O Allah! Whatever blessing has come to me in the evening, or to any of Your creation; these blessings are from You alone; You have no partner. So all praise is for You. And all gratitude is due to You.

Abu Dawood, No. 5075; Nasa'i, Amalul Yawmi wal Lailah, No. 7.

content_list.title: Four sentences heavier in weight than a whole morning of worship
content_list.content:
سُبْحَانَ اللّٰهِ وَبِحَمْدِهٖ عَدَدَ خَلْقِهٖ وَرِضَا نَفْسِهٖ وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهٖ وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهٖ

Meaning: I declare the glorious purity of Allah with His praise, equal to the number of His creation, His pleasure, the weight of His Throne, and the number of His words (ink).

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2726

content_list.title: Dua for beneficial knowledge, pure provision, and acceptable deeds
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا

O Allah! I ask You for beneficial knowledge, pure provision, and acceptable deeds.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to recite this dua in the morning.

Ibn Majah, No. 925; Ibnus Sunni, Amalul Yawmi wal Lailah, No. 54.

content_list.title: Protection from the harm of poisonous creatures
content_list.content:
Whoever recites this dua three times in the evening, no poisonous creature will be able to harm him that night.

أَعُوْذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللّٰهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.

Ahmad, No. 7898; Tirmidhi, Hadith 3437

content_list.title: Dua for acceptance of deeds
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ السَّمِيْعُ الْعَلِيمُ

Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَآ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيْمُ

And accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

Surah Al-Baqarah - 2:127-128

content_list.title: Dua for the good of this world and the hereafter
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِيْ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَّفِيْ الْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَّقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ

Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

Surah Al-Baqarah - 2:201

content_list.title: Prayer for patience, steadfastness and victory
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْراً وَّثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَانْصُرْنَا عَلَى القَوْمِ الكَافِرِيْنَ

Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

Surah Al-Baqarah - 2:250

content_list.title: The last 2 verses of Surah Baqarah: Expression of obedience, forgiveness and prayer for help
content_list.content:
اٰمَنَ الرَّسُوْلُ بِمَاۤ اُنْزِلَ اِلَیْهِ مِنْ رَّبِّهِۦ وَ الْمُؤْمِنُوْنَ ؕ     كُلٌّ اٰمَنَ بِاللّٰهِ وَ مَلٰٓىِٕكَتِهٖ وَ كُتُبِهٖ وَ رُسُلِهٖ ۫      لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَیْنَ اَحَدٍ مِّنْ رُّسُلِهٖ ۫      وَ قَالُوْا سَمِعْنَا وَ اَطَعْنَا   ؗۗ    غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَ اِلَیْكَ الْمَصِیْرُ ۝ لَا یُكَلِّفُ اللّٰهُ نَفْسًا اِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ؕ     لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَ عَلَیْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ ؕ      رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَاۤ اِنْ نَّسِیْنَاۤ اَوْ اَخْطَاْنَا ۚ  رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَیْنَاۤ اِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهٗ عَلَی الَّذِیْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِنَا ۚ  رَبَّنَا وَ لَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهٖ ۚ   وَ اعْفُ عَنَّا   ۥ وَ اغْفِرْ لَنَا ۥ وَ ارْحَمْنَا  ۥ اَنْتَ مَوْلٰىنَا فَانْصُرْنَا عَلَی الْقَوْمِ الْكٰفِرِیْنَ۠ ۝

Meaning: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], We make no distinction between any of His messengers. And they say, We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination. Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned.

Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we cannot bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.

(Surah Al-Baqarah, verses 285-286)

content_list.title: Dua for steadfastness on guidance
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا لاَ تُزِغْ قُلُوْبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِنْ لَّدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْوَهَّابُ

Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.

[Surah Al-Imran, verse 8]

content_list.title: Seeking forgiveness and deliverance from Hell
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوْبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ

Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

Surah Al-Imran, verse 16

content_list.title: Dua for righteous offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ هَبْ لِيْ مِنْ لَدُنْكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيْعُ الدُّعَاءِ

My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.

Surah Al-Imran - 3:38

content_list.title: Dua for acknowledging Tawheed and Risalat and for being included among the witnesses
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا بِمَا اَنْزَلْتَ وَاتَّبَعْنَا الرَّسُوْلَ فَاكْتُبْنَا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِيْنَِ

Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger, so register us among the witnesses.

Surah Al-Imran - 3:53

content_list.title: Prayer for forgiveness, steadfastness and victory
content_list.content:
ربَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوْبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِيْ أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وْانْصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِيْنَِ

Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

Surah Al-Imran - 3:147

content_list.title: Dua for the good of the Hereafter
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقْتَ هَذا بَاطِلاً سُبْحَانَكَ فَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ

Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ مَنْ تُدْخِلِ النَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُ وَمَا لِلظَّالِمِيْنَ مِنْ أَنْصَارٍ

Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

رَّبَّنَا إِنَّنَا سَمِعْنَا مُنَادِيًا يُّنَادِيْ لِلْإِيْمَانِ أَنْ آمِنُوْا بِرَبِّكُمْ فَآمَنَّا ۚ رَبَّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوْبَنَا وَكَفِّرْ عَنَّا سَيِّئَاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ الْأَبْرَارِ

Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in Your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die with the righteous.

رَبَّنَا وَآتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلَىٰ رُسُلِكَ وَلَا تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِيْعَادَ

Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise.

Surah Al-Imran - 3:191-194

content_list.title: Dua of the oppressed for help from Allah
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْ هَٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ الظَّالِمِ أَهْلُهَا وَاجْعَلْ لَنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ وَلِيًّا وَّاجْعَلْ لَنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ نَصِيْرًا

Our Lord, take us out of this city whose people are oppressors and make for us from Yourself a protector and make for us from Yourself a helper.

Surah An-Nisa - 4:75

content_list.title: Prayer for forgiveness
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِنْ لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُوْنَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِيْنَ

Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.

Surah Al-A'raf - 7:23

content_list.title: Dua for not being included among the wrongdoers
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا لاَ تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people.

Surah Al-A'raf - 7:47

content_list.title: Prayer for patience and death as a Muslim
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَّتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِيْنَ

Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You].

Surah Al-A'raf - 7:126

content_list.title: Dua for deliverance from the trial of the wrongdoers
content_list.content:
عَلَى اللّٰهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

Upon Allah we have relied. Our Lord, make us not a trial for the wrongdoing people.

وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِيْنَ

And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.

Surah Yunus - 10:85-86

content_list.title: Dua after boarding a boat or vehicle [11:41]
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ مَجْر۪ىٰهَا وَمُرْسَىٰهَآۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَغَفُوْرٌ رَّحِيْمٌ

In the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah Hud - 11:41

content_list.title: Dua for oneself and one's descendants
content_list.content:
رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مُقِيْمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِيْ ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ

My Lord, enable me to establish prayer, and from my descendants as well. Our Lord, accept my supplication.

Surah Ibrahim, verse 40

content_list.title: Seeking forgiveness for oneself, one's parents and all believers
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِيْ وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِيْنَ يَوْمَ يَقُوْمُ الْحِسَابُ

Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established.

Surah Ibrahim, verse 41

content_list.title: Dua for parents
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ ارْحَمْهُمَا كَمَا رَبَّيَانِيْ صَغِيْرًا

My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small.

Surah Al-Isra, verse: 24

content_list.title: Dua for mercy and right guidance
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آتِنَا مِنْ لَّدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً وَّهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا

Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance.

Surah Al-Kahf, verse: 10

content_list.title: Dua to remove stuttering
content_list.content:
رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِيْ صَدْرِيْ وَيَسِّرْ لِيْ أَمْرِيْ وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِّنْ لِّسَانِيْ يَفْقَهُوْا قَوْلِيْ

My Lord, expand for me my chest, ease for me my task, and remove the impediment from my tongue, so that they may understand my speech.

Surah Taha, verses: 25-28

content_list.title: Dua for increase in knowledge
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ زِدْنِى عِلْمًا

My Lord, increase me in knowledge.

Surah Taha, verse: 114

content_list.title: Dua for relief from sorrow and distress
content_list.content:
أَنِّيْ مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنْتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِيْنَ

Indeed, I am afflicted with hardship, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.

Surah Al-Anbiya, verse: 83

content_list.title: Dua for having children
content_list.content:
رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِيْ فَرْدًا وَّأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِيْنَ

My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors.

Surah Al-Anbiya, verse: 89

content_list.title: Dua for not being included among the wrongdoers [23:94]
content_list.content:
رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِيْ فِيْ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, verse: 94

content_list.title: Seeking refuge from the incitement of Satan
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِيْنِ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَنْ يَّحْضُرُوْنِ

My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils, And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, verses: 97-98

content_list.title: Prayer for forgiveness and mercy
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِيْنَ

Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, verse: 109

content_list.title: Prayer for forgiveness and mercy
content_list.content:
رَّبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِيْنَ
