My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful.

Surah Al-Mu'minun, verse: 118

content_list.title: Seeking refuge from the punishment of Hell
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا

Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering.

Surah Al-Furqan, verse: 65

content_list.title: Prayer for a comforting wife and children and to be a leader of the righteous
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَّاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِيْنَ إِمَامًا

Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous.

Surah Al-Furqan, verse: 74

content_list.title: Dua for wisdom, good reputation and deliverance from Hell
content_list.content:
رَبِّ هَبْ لِيْ حُكْمًا وَّأَلْحِقْنِيْ بِالصَّالِحِيْنَ وَاجْعَل لِّيْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِيْ الْآخِرِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنْ وَّرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيْمِ

My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous. And grant me a reputation of truth among the later generations. And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

Surah Ash-Shu'ara - 26:83-85

content_list.title: Prayer for thanksgiving and acceptance of deeds
content_list.content:
رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِيْ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِيْ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِيْ بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِيْ عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِيْنَ

My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants.

Surah An-Naml, verse: 19

content_list.title: Seeking refuge from the wrongdoing people
content_list.content:
رَبِّ نَجِّنِيْ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people.

Surah Al-Qasas, verse: 21

content_list.title: Dua for seeking the grace of Allah
content_list.content:
رَبِّ إِنِّيْ لِمَا أَنْزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيْرٌ

My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need.

Surah Al-Qasas, verse: 24

content_list.title: Prayer for help against the mischievous people
content_list.content:
رَبِّ انْصُرْنِيْ عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْمُفْسِدِيْنَ

My Lord, support me against the corrupting people.

Surah Al-Ankabut, verse: 30

content_list.title: Dua for righteous offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ هَبْ لِيْ مِنَ الصَّالِحِيْنَ

My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous.

Surah As-Saffat, verse: 100

content_list.title: Prayer for thanksgiving, good deeds and righteous offspring
content_list.content:
رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِيْ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِيْ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَصْلِحْ لِيْ فِيْ ذُرِّيَّتِيْ ۖ إِنِّيْ تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَإِنِّيْ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِيْنَ

My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims.

Surah Al-Ahqaf, verse: 15

content_list.title: Seeking forgiveness for the preceding believers and praying for no malice in the hearts of the believers towards each other
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَانِنَا الَّذِيْنَ سَبَقُوْنَا بِالْإِيْمَانِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِيْ قُلُوْبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِيْنَ آمَنُوْا رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ رَءُوْفٌ رَّحِيْمٌ

Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful.

Surah Al-Hashr, verse: 10

content_list.title: Prayer for light and forgiveness
content_list.content:
رَبَّنَا أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُوْرَنَا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا إِنَّكَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ

Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent.

Surah At-Tahrim, verse: 8

content_list.title: Acknowledgment of trust in Allah and turning to Him
content_list.content:
رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيْرُ

Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

Surah Al-Mumtahanah, verse: 4

content_list.title: Dua of Istikhara prayer
content_list.subtitle: Istikhara should be done before making any permissible worldly decision.
content_list.content:
Jabir ibn Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them both) said,

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to teach us Istikhara (i.e., the prayer and dua for seeking good) in all matters, just as he used to teach us a Surah from the Quran.

He said, When one of you intends to do something, he should offer two rak’ahs of non-obligatory prayer, then he should say,

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَسْتَخِيْرُكَ بِعِلْمِكَ، وَأَسْتَقْدِرُكَ بِقُدْرَتِكَ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ العَظِيْمِ

O Allah! I seek Your guidance with Your knowledge, and I seek Your power with Your might, and I ask for Your great favor.

فَإِنَّكَ تَقْدِرُ وَلاَ أَقْدِرُ، وَتَعْلَمُ وَلاَ أَعْلَمُ، وَأَنْتَ عَلاَّمُ الغُيُوْبِ

For You are powerful, and I am powerless. You are knowledgeable, and I am ignorant, and You are the Knower of the unseen.

اللّٰهُمَّ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الأمْرَ خَيْرٌ لِيْ فِيْ دِيْنِيْ وَمَعَاشِيْ وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِي، فَاقْدُرْهُ لِيْ وَيَسِّرْهُ لِيْ ثُمَّ بَارِكْ لِيْ فِيْهِ

O Allah! If this matter (here he should mention the intended matter or thing in his mind) is good for me in my religion, my livelihood, and the outcome of my affairs, then decree it for me and make it easy for me, then bless me in it.

وَإِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الْأَمْرَ شَرٌّ لِيْ فِيْ دِيْنِيْ وَمَعَاشِيْ وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِيْ فَاصْرِفْهُ عَنِّيْ وَاصْرِفْنِيْ عَنْهُ وَاقْدُرْ لِيَ الْخَيْرَ حَيْثُ كَانَ، ثُمَّ أَرْضِنِيْ بِهِ

And if this matter is harmful to me in my religion, my livelihood, and the outcome of my affairs, then turn it away from me and turn me away from it, and decree for me what is good wherever it may be, then make me content with it. [1]

That individual who seeks goodness from the Creator, consults with believers, and makes inquiries before undertaking any task will never regret it. This is because Allah Subhanahu Wa Ta'ala says,

وَشَاوِرْهُمْ فِيْ الْاَمْرِ ۚ فَاِذَا عَزَمْتَ فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَيْ اللّٰهِ

"And consult with them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allah." [2]

[1] Bukhari, 7/162, no. 1162.

[2] Surah Al-Imran: 159.

P.S.:

After performing the Salat al-Istikhara, if your heart inclines towards a particular direction, you should consider that to be from Allah. If you remain undecided, you can perform this prayer multiple times. This prayer can be performed at any time. After the prayer, you should continue to seek help from Allah by making dua. Following this, you should make a decision based on where your heart inclines.

Many people believe that the Salat al-Istikhara must be performed at night before sleeping and that dreaming is a necessary part of the process. However, these are not essential conditions.

It is advisable to perform istikhara before deciding on any permissible or lawful matter. For example, whether to travel to a certain place, buy a particular piece of furniture for the house, which university or subject to enroll in, or whether to leave a job for another office. When a potential spouse is found, istikhara can be performed to decide whether to agree to the marriage. However, istikhara cannot be performed regarding whether to fulfill an obligatory or mandatory matter. For example, you cannot perform istikhara on whether you should get married at all or whether to perform Hajj after it has become mandatory. Instead, it can be used to select a Hajj agency or a specific spouse.

content_list.title: Dua for the newly married
content_list.content:
بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ، وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَمَعَ بَيْنَكُمَا فِيْ خَيْرٍ

May Allah bless you, and may He bless you, and may He unite you both in goodness.

[Abu Dawood, No. 2130; Tirmidhi, No. 1091; Ibn Majah, No. 1905; Nasa'i, Amalul Yawmi wal-Lailah, No. 259.]

content_list.title: Congratulations to the one who has a child and his reply
content_list.content:
بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ فِيْ الْمَوْهُوْبِ لَكَ، وَشَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ، وَبَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ، وَرُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ

May Allah bless you in the gift that has been given to you, may you be grateful to the Giver, may the child reach full maturity, and may you be blessed with his good behavior.

[This is a saying of Hasan al-Basri (may Allah have mercy on him). Source: Tuhfatul Mawdud li Ibnil Qayyim, p. 20]

In reply to the congratulations, the father of the child will say,

بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَزَاكَ اللّٰهُ خَيْراً، وَرَزَقَكَ اللّٰهُ مِثْلَهُ، وَأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ

May Allah bless you, and may He send blessings upon you. May Allah reward you with good, and may Allah grant you the same, and may He increase your reward manifold.

[Al-Adhkar, p. 349]

content_list.title: Dua as an expiation at the end of a gathering
content_list.content:
۞ سُبْحَانَكَ اللّٰهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ ، اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لَّا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااَنْتَ اَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَاَتُوْبُ اِلَيْكَ

Meaning: O Allah! I declare Your purity, I praise You. I bear witness that there is no god but You. I seek Your forgiveness, I repent to You.

Virtue: It is mentioned in the hadith that if someone recites this dua at the end of a gathering, all the sins he has committed in the gathering will be forgiven.

[Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3433]

Sometimes at the end of a gathering, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) would pray for the Companions in this way—

اَللّٰهُمَّ اقْسِمْ لَنَا مِنْ خَشْيَتِكَ مَا يَحُوْلُ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ مَعَاصِيْكَ ، وَمِنْ طَاعَتِكَ مَا تُبَلِّغُنَا بِهٖ جَنَّتَكَ ، وَمِنَ الْيَقِـيْنِ مَا تُهَوِّنُ بِهٖ عَلَيْنَا مُصِيْبَاتِ الدُّنْيَا ، وَمَتِّعْنَا بِاَسْمَاعِنَا وَاَبْصَارِنَا وَقُوَّتِنَا مَا اَحْيَيْتَنَا ، وَاجْعَلْهُ الْوَارِثَ مِنَّا ، وَاجْعَلْ ثَاْرَنَا عَلٰـى مَنْ ظَلَمَنَا ، وَانْصُرْنَا عَلٰـى مَنْ عَادَانَا ، وَلَا تَجْعَلْ مُصِيْبَتَنَا فِـيْ دِيْنِنَا ، وَلَا تَجْعَلِ الدُّنْيَا اَكْبَرَ هَمِّنَا وَلَا مَبْلَغَ عِلْمِنَا ، وَلَا تُسَلِّطْ عَلَيْنَا مَنْ لَّا يَرْحَمُنَا.

O Allah! Grant us such fear of You that will keep us away from disobeying You. Grant us such obedience to You that will lead us to Paradise. Grant us such certainty of faith that will make the hardships of this world seem light to us. As long as we live, allow us to benefit from our hearing, our sight, and our strength, and let this continue among our descendants. Let us take vengeance only upon those who have wronged us, and grant us victory over those who show hostility towards us. O Allah! Do not let any trial befall us in our religion, and do not make this world the center of our concern or the limit of our knowledge. O Allah! Do not place over us anyone who will show us no mercy.

[Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3502]

content_list.title: Dua for refuge from all serious diseases
content_list.content:
اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبَرَصِ وَالْجُنُونِ وَالْجُذَامِ وَمِنْ سَيِّئِ الأَسْقَامِ

O Allah! I certainly seek refuge in You from vitiligo, insanity, leprosy, and all kinds of serious diseases.

(Abu Dawood 1554, Nasa'i 5493, Ahmad 12592)

content_list.title: Dua when fearing an enemy
content_list.content:
۞ حَسْبُنَا اللهُ وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيْلُ

Meaning: Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best Disposer of affairs.

Hazrat Ibn Abbas (RA) said that Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) recited this dua when he was thrown into the fire. And the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) also recited this dua when he was threatened by the enemy.

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنَّا نَجْعَلُكَ فِـيْ نُحُوْرِهِمْ وَنَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرُوْرِهِمْ

Meaning: O Allah! I place You against them, I seek refuge in You from their evil.

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اِلٰهَ جِبْرِيْلَ وَمِيْكَائِيْلَ وَاِسْرَافِيْلَ وَ اِلٰهَ اِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَاِسْمَاعِيْلَ وَاِسْحَاقَ عَافِنِـيْ وَلا تُسَلِّطَنَّ اَحَدًا مِنْ خَلْقِكَ عَلَيَّ بِشَيْءٍ لَا طَاقَةَ لِـيْ بِهِ

Meaning: O Allah! The God of Jibril, Mikail and Israfil! The God of Ibrahim, Ismail and Ishaq! Grant me security. Do not impose upon me any of Your creation that I do not have the power to deal with.

۞ During the Hijrah, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) recited this dua out of fear of the attack of the Quraysh—

اَللّٰهُمَّ اكْفِنَاهُ بِمَا شِئْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! Be sufficient for us against him in whatever way You wish.

content_list.title: Dua to be recited when fearing the oppression of a ruler
content_list.content:
۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ ، وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ ، كُنْ لِـيْ جَارًا مِنْ فُلَانِ بْنِ فُلَانٍ وَاَحْزَابِهٖ مِنْ خَلَائِقِكَ ، اَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيَّ اَحَدٌ مِنْهُمْ اَوْ يَطْغٰى ، عَزَّ جَارُكَ ، وَجَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ ، وَلَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اَنْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens! Lord of the great Throne! Be a protector for me from so-and-so son of so-and-so and his allies from among Your creation, lest any of them should transgress against me, or should oppress me. Your protection is mighty. Your praise is glorious. There is no god but You.

Virtue: Hazrat Abdullah ibn Mas'ud (RA) said that if any of you fears any oppression from the ruler, he should recite this dua.

[Bukhari, Al-Adab Al-Mufrad, No. 707]

content_list.title: Curse upon the enemy
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ مُنْزِلَ الْكِتَابِ، سَرِيْعَ الْحِسَابِ، اهْزِمِ الأَحْزَابَ، اللّٰهُمَّ اهزِمْهُمْ وَزَلْزِلْهُمْ

Meaning: O Allah! Revealer of the Book! Swift in taking account! O Allah! Defeat the confederates. O Allah! Defeat them and shake them.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prayed in this way against the enemies on the day of the Battle of the Trench.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 2933]

content_list.title: Dua of a person who has fallen into doubt in his faith 1
content_list.content:
The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: Satan comes to one of you and says, Who created this? Who created that? In this way, at one point he says: Who created your Lord! When someone reaches this situation (and doubt arises in his faith), he should seek refuge in Allah Ta'ala and refrain from such thoughts.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3576]

Dua for seeking refuge in Allah from Satan:

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan.

content_list.title: Dua of a person who has fallen into doubt in his faith 2
content_list.content:
هُوَ الْأوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ وَالظّاهِرُ وَالْبَاطِنُ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيْمٌ

He is the First, He is the Last, He is above all, He is near to all, and He is All-Knowing about everything.

[Abu Dawood 4/329, No. 5112]

content_list.title: Dua to remove Satan and his whispers
content_list.content:
He will seek refuge in Allah from him

أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجيْمِ

I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan

Ibn Majah, No. 807

content_list.title: Dua to be saved from shirk
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ إِنِّيْ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ أَنْ أُشْرِكَ بِكَ وَأَنَا أَعْلَمُ، وَأَسْتَغْفِرُكَ لِمَا لاَ أَعْلَمُ

O Allah! I seek refuge in You from associating partners with You knowingly, and I seek Your forgiveness for what I do unknowingly.

[Ahmad, No. 19606]

content_list.title: When visiting a sick person
content_list.content:
۞ لَا بَاْسَ طَهُوْرٌ اِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ

Meaning: Do not worry, Insha'Allah, (you will be cured and) your sins will be forgiven through this illness.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 3616]

۞ اَسْاَلُ اللهَ الْعَظِيْمَ رَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ اَنْ يَشْفِيَكَ

Meaning: I ask Allah, the Great, the Lord of the great Throne, to heal you. (This dua should be recited seven times.)

It is mentioned in the hadith that if someone visits a sick person and recites this dua seven times, Allah will cure him, unless his time of death has come.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 3108]

۞ اَذْهِبِ الْبَاسَ رَبَّ النَّاسِ ، اِشْفِ وَاَنْتَ الشَّافِـيْ لَا شِفَاءَ اِلَّاشِفَاؤُكَ شِفَاءً لَا يُغَادِرُ سَقَمًا

Meaning: O Lord of all people! Remove this disease, cure it. You are the Curer. There is no cure except Yours. Cure it in such a way that no illness remains.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5675]

۞ بِاسْمِ اللهِ اَرْقِـيْكَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ يُؤْذِيْكَ مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ نَفْسٍ اَوْ عَيْنِ حَاسِدٍ ، اَللهُ يَشْفِيْكَ ، بِاسْمِ اللهِ اَرْقِـيْكَ

Meaning: In the name of Allah I perform Ruqyah for you, from everything that is harming you, from the evil of every soul, from the envious eye of the envier. May Allah cure you. In the name of Allah I perform Ruqyah for you.

It is mentioned in the hadith that once the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) fell ill, Hazrat Jibril (AS) recited this dua and blew on him.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2186]

content_list.title: Dua for visiting the grave
content_list.content:
۞ اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ يَا اَهْلَ القُبُوْرِ يَغْفِرُ اللهُ لَنَا وَلَكُمْ اَنْتُمْ سَلَفُنَا وَنَحْنُ بِالْاَثَرِ

Meaning: O inhabitants of the graves! Peace be upon you. May Allah forgive us and you. You are our predecessors, we are behind you.

[Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1053]

Or—

اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ دَارَ قَوْمٍ مُؤْمِنِيْنَ وَاِنَّا اِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ بِكُمْ لَاحِقُوْنَ

Meaning: O believers! Peace be upon you. If Allah wills, we will surely meet you.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 249]

Or—

السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيَارِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُSْلِمِينَ وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَلاَحِقُونَ أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ لَنَا وَلَكُمُ الْعَافِيَةَ

Meaning: O inhabitants of the graves! Believers and Muslims! Peace be upon you. We, Insha'Allah, will meet you. I ask Allah for security for us and for you.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 975]

content_list.title: When feeling pain somewhere in the body
content_list.content:
بِسْمِ اللّٰهِ اَعُوْذُ بِعِزَّةِ اللّٰهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ , مِنْ شَرِّ مَا اَجِدُ وَاُحَاذِرُ

Meaning: In the name of Allah (I am reading). I seek refuge in the power and might of Allah from the evil of the pain I feel and the fear I have.

Benefit: Place the right hand on the place of pain and recite this dua seven times. Hazrat Uthman ibn Abul-As (RA) said, I once went to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) suffering from pain. He told me to place my right hand on the place of pain and recite this dua seven times. I did so. Then Allah cured me.

[Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 3522]

content_list.title: Dua for relief from calamities
content_list.content:
When faced with any calamity or something distressing happens

اِنَّا لِلّٰهِ وَاِنَّا اِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُوْنَ

Meaning: Surely we belong to Allah, and Him we shall surely return.

[Surah Al-Baqarah, verse 156]

اِنَّا لِلّٰهِ وَاِنَّا اِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُوْنَ اَللّٰهُمَّ اْجُرْنِـيْ فِـيْ مُصِيْبَتِـيْ وَاَخْلِفْ لِـيْ خَيْرًا مِنْهَا

Meaning: Surely we belong to Allah, and Him we shall surely return. O Allah! Please reward me for my calamity and give me something better in return for what I have lost.

[Sahih Muslim, Hadith 918]

For freedom from debt, for relief from sorrow and anxiety

اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْجُبْنِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَاَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ غَلَبَةِ الدَّيْنِ وَقَهْرِ الرِّجَالِ

Meaning: O Allah! I seek refuge in You from anxiety and grief, I seek refuge in You from inability and laziness, I seek refuge in You from cowardice and miserliness, I seek refuge in You from the burden of debt and the oppression of men.

Recite this dua in the morning and evening. [Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 1557]

لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ الْعَظِيْمُ الْحَلِيْمُ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَرَبُّ الْاَرْضِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيْمِ

Meaning: There is no god but Allah, the Great, the Forbearing. There is no god but Allah, the Lord of the great Throne. There is no god but Allah, the Lord of the heavens, the Lord of the earth, and the Lord of the noble Throne.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to recite this dua in times of distress.

[Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6346]

For freedom from debt

اَللّٰهُمَّ اكْفِنِـيْ بِحَلَالِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ ، وَاَغْنِنِـيْ بِفَضْلِكَ عَنْ مَّنْ سِوَاكَ

Meaning: O Allah! Make what You have made lawful for me sufficient from what You have made unlawful, and make me independent of everyone except You by Your grace.

[Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3563]

For removing troubles and making difficult tasks easy

لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ اِنِّـيْ كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِيْنَ

(O Allah!) There is no deity except You. You are Pure. Surely, I have been among the wrongdoers.

The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said, Whenever a Muslim recites this supplication and makes duʿāʾ, his duʿāʾ is accepted.

[Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3505]

اَللّٰهُمَّ لَا سَهْلَ اِلَّا مَا جَعَلْتَهٗ سَهْلًا ، وَاَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزَنَ اِذَا شِئْتَ سَهْلًا

Meaning: O Allah! There is nothing easy except what You make easy, and You make the difficult easy if You so will.

[Bayhaqi, Ad-Daʿwat al-Kabīr, Hadith 265]

اَللّٰهُمَّ الْطُفْ بِـيْ فِـيْ تَيْسِيْرِ كُلِّ عَسِيْرٍ فَاِنَّ تَيْسِيْرَ كُلِّ عَسِيْرٍ عَلَيْكَ يَسِيْرٌ وَاَسْاَلُكَ الْيُسْرَ وَالْمُعَافَاةَ فِـيْ الدُّنْيَا وَالْاٰخِرَةِ

O Allah! By Your mercy, make all difficult tasks easy for me. Making all difficult tasks easy is easy for you. And I ask You for ease and safety in this world and the Hereafter.

[Al-Jāmiʿ al-Ṣaghīr, Hadīth 1527]

لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااللهُ الْحَلِيْمُ الْكَرِيْمُ ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَتَبَارَكَ اللهُ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِيْنَ

There is no deity except Allah, the Most Forbearing, the Most Noble. Allah is free from all imperfections and full of Majesty. He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne. All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.

It is narrated that ʿAbdullāh ibn Jaʿfar (RA) would recite these words and blow upon a person when they had a fever.

[Musnad Ahmad, ḥadīth 701]

اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ عَبْدُكَ، وَابْنُ عَبْدِكَ، وَابْنُ اَمَتِكَ، نَاصِيَتِـيْ بِيَدِكَ، مَاضٍ فِـيَّ حُكْمُكَ، عَدْلٌ فِـيَّ قَضَاؤُكَ، اَسْاَلُكَ بِكُلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ، سَمَّيْتَ بِهٖ نَفْسَكَ، اَوْ اَنْزَلْتَهٗ فِـيْ كِتَابِكَ، اَوْ عَلَّمْتَهٗ اَحَدًا مِّنْ خَلْقِكَ، اَوِ اسْتَاْثَرْتَ بِهٖ فِـيْ عِلْمِ الْغَيْبِ عِنْدَكَ، اَنْ تَجْعَلَ الْقُرْاٰنَ رَبِيْعَ قَلْبِـيْ، وَنُوْرَ بَصَرِيْ، وَجِلَاءَ حُزْنِـيْ، وَذَهَابَ هَمِّـيْ

O Allah! Indeed, I am Your servant, the son of Your servant, the son of Your maidservant. My forelock is in Your hand, Your command over me is ever executed, and Your decree over me is just. I ask You by every Name belonging to You which You have named Yourself with, revealed in Your Book, taught to any of Your creation, or kept with Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen — that You make the Qur’an the spring of my heart, the light of my chest, the remover of my sorrow, and the reliever of my distress.

[Al-Muʿjam al-Kabīr, Hadīth 10198]

اَللّٰهُمَّ رَحْمَتَكَ اَرْجُوْ فَلَا تَكِلْنِـيْ اِلٰـى نَفْسِـيْ طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ ، وَاَصْلِحْ لِـيْ شَاْنِـيْ كُلَّهُ لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااَنْتَ

Meaning: O Allah! It is Your mercy that I hope for, so do not leave me to my care even for the blink of an eye. Set right all of my affairs. There is no deity except You.

Fāʾidah (Benefit): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said, this is the supplication of a person in distress.

[Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 5092]

When in distress

لَا اِلٰهَ اِلَّااللهُ الْحَلِيْمُ الْكَرِيْمُ ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ ، وَرَبِّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيْمِ

Meaning: There is no deity except Allah, the Most Forbearing, the Most Generous. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Mighty Throne. Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Honorable Throne.

[Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 3883]

content_list.title: When fearing a calamity
content_list.content:
اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَسْاَلُكَ الْعَافِيَةَ فِـيْ الدُّنْيَا وَالْاٰخِرَةِ ، اَللّٰهُمَّ اِنِّـيْ اَسْاَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِـيْ دِيْنِـيْ وَدُنْيَايَ وَاَهْلِـيْ وَمَالِـيْ ، اَللّٰهُمَّ اسْتُرْ عَوْرَاتِـيْ ، وَاٰمِنْ رَوْعَاتِـيْ ، اَللّٰهُمَّ احْفَظْنِـيْ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ ، وَمِنْ خَلْفِـيْ ، وَعَنْ يَمِيْنِـيْ ، وَعَنْ شِمَالِـيْ ، وَمِنْ فَوْقِـيْ ، وَاَعُوْذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ اَنْ اُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِـيْ

Meaning: O Allah! I ask You for security in this world and the hereafter. O Allah! I ask You for forgiveness and security in my religion, my worldly affairs, my family, and my wealth. O Allah! Cover my faults and keep me safe from my fears. O Allah! Protect me from my front, from my back, from my right and left, and from above me. I seek refuge in Your greatness from being swallowed up from beneath me. (That is, protect me from calamities from below as well.)

content_list.title: Dua to suppress anger
content_list.content:
أَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ

I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan.

Bukhari, No. 3282; Muslim, No. 2610

content_list.title: Dua to be recited when seeing a distressed and afflicted person
content_list.content:
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ عَافَانِيْ مِمَّا ابْتَلاَكَ بِهِ، وَفَضَّلَنِيْ عَلَى كَثِيْرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِيْلاً

All praise is for Allah, who has kept me safe from the trial you have been put through, and has honored me more than many of His creation.

Tirmidhi, No. 3432

content_list.title: What to say when faced with something pleasant or unpleasant
content_list.content:
When something pleasant came to the Prophet (peace be upon him), he would say,

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِيْ بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ

All praise is for Allah, by whose grace all good things are perfected.

And when something unpleasant came to him, he would say,

اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ

All praise is for Allah in all circumstances.

This hadith was compiled by Ibnus Sunni, Amalul Yawmi wal-Lailah, No. 377.

content_list.title: Dua for the one you have cursed
content_list.content:
اللّٰهُمَّ فَأَيُّمَا مُؤْمِنٍ سَبَبْتُهُ فَاجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ لَهُ قُرْبَةً إِلَيْكَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

O Allah! Whichever believer I have cursed, make that a means of nearness to You for him on the Day of Resurrection.

[Bukhari, No. 6361]

content_list.title: Dua after eating an invitation
content_list.content:
۞ اَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الْاَبْرَارُ ، وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ ، وَاَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُوْنَ

Meaning: May the righteous eat your food, may the angels pray for you, and may the fasting break their fast with you.

[Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 12406]

This dua can also be recited if someone provides Iftar.

۞ اَللّٰهُمَّ اَطْعِمْ مَنْ اَطْعَمَنِـيْ ، وَاسْقِ مَنْ سَقَانِـيْ

Meaning: O Allah! Feed the one who has fed me, and give drink to the one who has given me to drink.

[Musnad Ahmad, Hadith 23809]
